Interface DataBaseManager<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Implementation is specific to a type of object
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClaimDBManager, EftDBManager, ServiceDBManager, UserDBManager

    public interface DataBaseManager<T>
    DataBaseManager is the abstract base class for all managers accessing the DataBase. They need to implement a basic set of function accessing their own part of the DataBase.

    Classes implementing this should get the ArrayList corresponding to the correct type from the DataBase.

    Author:
    Philippe Caron, Gevrai Jodoin-Tremblay
    See Also:
    DataBase

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(T elem)
      Adds an object to the DataBase
      T delete(int id)
      Removes an object from the DataBase based on its ID, and returns it.
      boolean delete(T elem)
      Deletes an objects from the DataBase, if it exists.
      boolean exists(T key)
      Looks through the DataBase if a specific object exists or not, returning true if it does, false if it doesn't
      java.util.ArrayList<T> filter(java.lang.String search)
      Filters through all objects in the DataBase, returning a list of objects which have a string containing the keyword 'search', case insensitive.
      T find(int id)
      Looks through the specific DataBase to find an object with the specified ID, returning it if found, or null if not.
      int getUniqueID()
      Gives an unused ID from a specific type of element in the DataBase, mainly used for primary key.

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueID

        int getUniqueID()
        Gives an unused ID from a specific type of element in the DataBase, mainly used for primary key.
        Returns:
        unused ID for a type of element

      • find

        T find(int id)
        Looks through the specific DataBase to find an object with the specified ID, returning it if found, or null if not.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the object T needed.
        Returns:
        The object T with the correct id, null if not found.

      • exists

        boolean exists(T key)
        Looks through the DataBase if a specific object exists or not, returning true if it does, false if it doesn't
        Parameters:
        key - the object to seek existence in the DB
        Returns:
        true if the object exists, false otherwise

      • add

        boolean add(T elem)
        Adds an object to the DataBase

        Looks if an object with the same ID already exists in the DB, in which case doesn't add it and returns false.

        Parameters:
        elem - the object to add to the DB
        Returns:
        true if the object was added, false otherwise

      • delete

        boolean delete(T elem)
        Deletes an objects from the DataBase, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        elem - the object to delete from the DB
        Returns:
        true if the object was deleted, false otherwise

      • delete

        T delete(int id)
        Removes an object from the DataBase based on its ID, and returns it. If none was found, simply returns null.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the object to delete from the DB
        Returns:
        The object deleted from the DB, null if none was found.

      • filter

        java.util.ArrayList<T> filter(java.lang.String search)
        Filters through all objects in the DataBase, returning a list of objects which have a string containing the keyword 'search', case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        search - the keyword to find
        Returns:
        ArrayList of objects containing the keyword.
